channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown vegetation on footpath between Mill Lane and footbridge, 11th June
item.description:
The public footpath connecting Mill Lane to the lower end of Greenway Farm (footbridge over brook) is overgrown with vegetation, making it difficult to pass easily. The footbridge is also in a poor state of repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ham Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: Eroded and overgrown path, 11th June
item.description:
The footpath that leads from Watermead to castle hill near the junction with green street is very overgrown with brambles and the path is deeply eroded and muddy

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 11th June
item.description:
Customer reports significant traffic accumulation on Kingsditch Lane, Manor Road and Swindon Road due to the sequencing of the signals at the location. They say that only one vehicle at a time is being allowed to pass before they change.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 11th June
item.description:
Customer reports that new growth/offshoots from the lower trunks of trees, at the location, are obscuring the view for drivers approaching the bend from the Bath Road direction. Parking in the area exacerbates the situation.

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 11th June
item.description:
28 day with give an take footway closure needed please cut back overgrown hedge an vegetation and brambles and stinging netels growing out into footway appropriately meters 100 meters long by 2 metres high (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign/waymarker is damaged problem, 11th June
item.description:
11/06/24 email rcvd - Location on footpath that cuts through from Swindon Village to industrial estate just before the bridge and behind 2 Farm Court. Gl51 9RB I would like to request a member of the team to look into replacing a very old, rusty and now almost ineligible sign post with way markers on, an elderly person with failing eyesight would not be able to read the signage in the post. I will forward photos. Also , Very near to this is a raised metal plate on the ground with a hole for a post which I recently tripped over making it a hazard as it had been covered in nettles. Please can this be investigated asap before someone else trips up and ends up seriously hurting themselves. Photos attached I look forward to hearing from you
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still hazardous, cones or not, 11th June
item.description:
Previously reported as urgent, someone came and put 2 cones on it and that’s all that’s been done. The cones get moved about which narrows the safe part of the pavement even more. Previous report says it’s closed to me but the grating is still caving in, the pavement is unsafe and all that’s been done is the cones adding to the obstruction. First reported on 26th May, that’s over 2 weeks my wheelchair user has been trying to dodge this hazard. Please help and get it sorted

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
